events.message: The applicant submitted the loan application to cover unexpected medical expenses and debt consolidation, explaining their current financial situation in detail.
The application was categorised under the Personal Loan category due to keywords related to medical and debt payments noted in the submission.
A dedicated loan officer was assigned to the case to assist the applicant through the evaluation and documentation processes.
The initial review included checking the completeness of the application and preliminary assessment of the applicant’s creditworthiness.
Additional documents such as proof of medical bills, identification, and recent bank statements were requested to proceed with verification.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents, including detailed medical invoices and debt statements, enabling further processing.
A comprehensive credit check was carried out, revealing a moderate credit score with some past minor delinquencies related to medical expenses.
The risk assessment evaluated potential repayment risks given the applicant’s current debts and income stability, concluding manageable risk.
A loan offer was presented to the applicant with favorable interest rates and flexible repayment options tailored to their financial needs.
The applicant responded positively to the offer, requesting a slight adjustment in the repayment schedule to better match their monthly income.
The application was escalated to a senior loan manager to review the requested repayment schedule adjustment and overall loan terms.
Following managerial review, the loan was approved with the adjusted repayment schedule as requested by the applicant.
Funds were successfully disbursed to the applicant’s account today, enabling them to address the medical bills and consolidate debt promptly.
A follow-up call was made to ensure the applicant is satisfied with their loan and to answer any questions about repayment schedules.
The application process was officially closed after successful funding and confirmation of applicant satisfaction with the loan terms.
